Crimes.Legal_Issue: Credibility findings and state protection analysis
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), Sections 96 and 97
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: RPD doubted credibility due to lack of direct evidence; court found RPD ignored relevant evidence of state corruption and drug-related crime
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: Applicants must demonstrate well-founded fear of persecution
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Lack of direct evidence affected credibility assessment
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Sections 96 and 97 of IRPA determine refugee status based on credible persecution fears and lack of state protection
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to consider context of state corruption
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution by Sinaloa cartel
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: RPD failed to fairly assess available evidence
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Evidence of state corruption, drug-related violence, and cartel influence
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Canadian refugee determination system under IRPA
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: RPD dismissal based on credibility and state protection
Crimes.Court_Result: Case remitted for redetermination by different panel
Crimes.Defendant_Response: RPD claimed applicants lacked credibility and state protection was available
Crimes.Outcome: RPD decision set aside, case remitted
Crimes.Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review under Federal Courts Act
Crimes.Applicable_Process: Refugee Protection Division hearing and judicial review
Crimes.Governing_Rule: IRPA and jurisprudence on refugee protection

Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: Murder following kidnapping, targeted due to perceived association
Crimes.Mitigating_Factors: Not applicable – state unable to protect
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Contextual evidence sufficient despite lack of direct documentation
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Affidavits, country condition reports, news articles
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Court found applicants' narrative credible when considered with country context
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: RPD unreasonably dismissed claims without considering cultural and systemic factors
Crimes.Risk_Assessment: High risk of harm or death if returned
Crimes.Targeted_Victimization: Yes – family targeted after Abel’s kidnapping and murder
Crimes.Geographic_Context: Sinaloa, Mexico – high cartel activity and corruption
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Failure to properly assess credibility and state protection
Crimes.Review_Mechanism: Judicial review under Federal Courts Act

Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: Murder as warning or retaliation, part of pattern of intimidation
Crimes.Mitigating_Factors: None – state complicity or incapacity present
Crimes.Criminality_Severity: Extreme – systematic use of murder to enforce control
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Country evidence supports likelihood of cartel impunity
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicants’ fear deemed reasonable given context
Crimes.Risk_Assessment: High risk upon return due to familial connection
Crimes.Targeted_Victimization: Yes – family targeted due to association
Crimes.Geographic_Context: Sinaloa, Mexico – known for cartel dominance

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refugee claim involving threats from cartel
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Issue: RPD failed to consider systemic corruption and lack of state protection
Crimes.Evidence_Disclosure_Status: Available country condition evidence not adequately weighed
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issue: Insufficient consideration of corruption and cartel power
Crimes.Procedural_Requirement: Fair and reasonable assessment of all relevant evidence
Crimes.Risk_Nexus: Threats linked to non-state actor (Sinaloa cartel)
Crimes.Evidence_Source: Country reports, UNHCR guidelines, academic studies
Crimes.Basis_for_Decision: Credibility and availability of state protection
Crimes.Charter_Issues: Right to life, liberty, and security (s. 7)
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Issues: Failure to engage with key evidence
Crimes.Accusation: Threats from Sinaloa cartel due to perceived association
Crimes.Credibility_Findings: RPD findings unreasonable in light of evidence
Crimes.Risk_Persecution: Well-founded fear due to cartel threats
Crimes.Relevant_Factors_Considered: Cartel violence, corruption, geographic risk, family targeting
Crimes.Decision_Level: RPD initial decision, reviewed by Federal Court
